Sequence Information.Peptide Name: AP-57 (AMP with 57 aa, C10orf9, natural AMPs, human, primates, mammals, animals; 2S=S, UCSS1)
Sequence Information.Source: antibody detection mainly in stomach, colon, and epityphlon tissues,Homo sapiens

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: proteomic study of secreted proteins.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (32.76%) toVicBacP=R: 14%, L: 11%. GRAVY: -0.75; Mol Wt: 6518.767; mol formula: C286H477N95O70S4; mol ex coeff: 11350. Poor similarity to known AMPs.Chemical modification: predicted two disulfide bonds: C1-C4 and C2-C3.Activity:  active against Gram+ S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MEC 21.50 ug/ml), L.monocytogenes (ATCC 19115 (MEC >200 ug/ml), Actinomyce isolated from clinical specimens (MEC 12.33 ug/ml), Gram- E. Coli ATCC 25922 (MEC 73.32 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa PA01 (MEC 86.45 ug/ml), S.  typhi RE88 (MEC 91.69 ug/ml), fungi C.albicans ATCC 10231 or CMCC(B) 98001 (MEC>200 ug/ml), A. niger ATCC 16404 (MEC 28.55 ug/ml), yeast ATCC 2601 (MEC>200 ug/ml), M. hominis clinical (MEC 4.77 ug/ml), and Lentivirus (MEC 16.50 ug/ml) and Adenovirus Ad5 (MEC >200 ug/ml).  MEC: Minimum effective concentration, which is the lowest protein concentration at which visual effects were observed (e.g.,  growth inhibition, microbe aggregation, infection efficiency decrease).Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: expressed and affinity and exchange chromatographically purified.
Literature Information.Author: Yang M, Tang M, Ma X, Yang L, He J, Peng X, Guo G, Zhou L, Luo N, Yuan Z, Tong A. 2015
Literature Information.Reference: Biochem Biophys Res Commun. 2015 Feb 13;457(3):347-52. doi: 10.1016/j.bbrc.2014.12.115.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: AP-57/C10orf99 is a new type of multifunctional antimicrobial peptide.
